content.rendered:
To reach Haridwar, one of the holiest pilgrimage places in India, you have several transportation options. You must consider factors such as cost, travel time, convenience, and starting location preferences to choose the best mode of transportation to reach Haridwar. Mentioned below are the best ways to reach Haridwar:-

By Air

If traveling to Haridwar, remember that the city has no airport. The most viable choice in that case will be to take an airplane from Dehradun’s very own Jolly Grant Airport, situated a mere 20 km away. From Dehradun to Haridwar, the distance will cost you about 52 km.  From the airport, a taxi is available to reach your desired destination. The journey takes less than two hours along the Ambala – Dehradun- Haridwar NH7 and 34.

If traveling to Delhi from Haridwar, flying into the well-known Indira Gandhi International Airport would be convenient. It is the busiest airport in India, serving domestic and international airlines. Tourists from the Delhi airport can easily avail of transport facilities to reach Haridwar, the city of divine bliss.

By Train

Haridwar has its own Railway station. The Haridwar Junction Railway Station operates trains to Delhi that take up four hours, Dehradun in one hour, and Rishikesh a little over an hour.

Haridwar Junction Railway station is located towards the southern part of this city, close to most hotels. Its two kilometres from Har Ki Pauri Ghat, a sacred Ghat of serenity.

Here is a list of trains to reach Haridwar:

  • 13009 Doon Express leaves from Howrah (Kolkata), Varanasi, Lucknow to Haridwar Junction
  • 12687 Chennai-Dehradun Express leaves from Chennai, Nizamuddin (Delhi) to Haridwar Junction
  • 12054 Jan Shatabdi Express from Amritsar to Haridwar Junction
  • 14632 Amritsar-Dehradun Express from Amritsar to Haridwar Junction
  • 14610 Hemkunt Express from Jammu to Haridwar Junction

By Road

Bus – Haridwar has good road connectivity. You will get several inter-state transport and private buses from Haridwar to Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, and other areas of Uttarakhand. As for the bus operations, it is comfortable owing to the services and very reasonable fares. The bus station is just a stone-throw away from the railway station at Haridwar. Booking a bus ticket in Haridwar can be best achieved by the Bus operators and getting your tickets booked in advance.

Taxi – Several cab firms offer service from Delhi to Haridwar. List of the approximate prices per kilometre charged from Delhi to Haridwar:-

  • Hatchback AC Seater – Rs. 9.5 per km
  • Sedan AC Seater – Rs. 10 per km
  • SUV AC Seater – Rs. 13 per km

The best way to travel to Haridwar

People have different ways of getting anywhere. The criteria for the selection of the best mode of reaching Haridwar should also reflect on issues like cost, convenience, and time. Alternatively, you can choose the best option based on your starting location preferences. While traveling to Haridwar by air, one must remember that there is no airport in Haridwar. The closest airport is in Dehradun- Jolly Grant Airport. Taxis and buses can also be used to reach Haridwar from the airport. It is more convenient to travel to Haridwar by bus. Haridwar has a very effective road system. Major cities like Delhi, U.P., Punjab, Haryana, and other states including the capital city of Uttarakhand have a regular bus service. Buses are one of the cheapest forms of transport.

Trains are also the most convenient mode of transport to Haridwar from many cities such as Delhi, Kolkata, Punjab U.P., Haryana, and others accordingly you may check train timings to book tickets.

How to travel within Haridwar

Commuting within Haridwar is made much easier by the local transport system. Local transport in Haridwar is by Auto-rickshaws, buses, Taxis, and also cycle Rickshaws. There are all these great alternatives to get around in the city. The auto-rickshaw will be charged up to 50 INR within a short time. You will need buses and also auto rickshaws from the railway stations.

That is, when communicating with the auto-rickshaws and taxis prices need to be negotiated because they try to overcharge the tourists. Bus and taxi are the most convenient ways of going around the Haridwar to visit the ashrams and temples. For long-duration travel, taxis will charge up to INR 400.
